intro: Holstia, commonly known as the yellow buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Holstia contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans if ingested. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
